intro: Diplaziopsis pycnocarpos, commonly known as the dense-fruited diplaziopsis, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae, which includes various ferns and fern allies. The plant features a creeping rhizome with erect, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its reproductive structures are small, clustered sporangia that produce spores for propagation. Diplaziopsis pycnocarpos is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices.
